text: Kochavi Shemesh (; 10 January 1944 â€“ 13 May 2019) was an Iraqi-born Israeli lawyer and leftist activist. He was one of the leaders of the Israeli Black Panthers protest movement. He served as editor of the movement's main publication Ha'panter Ha'shachor (, meaning "The Black Panther"). He also helped form the political party Hadash. The party formed as a merger between the Black Panthers, the Israeli Communist Party and other leftist organisations. He was born in Baghdad and grew up in Jerusalem. Shemesh died on 13 May 2019, at the age of 75. ==References== Category:1944 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Communists Category:Iraqi Jews Category:Iraqi lawyers Category:Israeli activists Category:Israeli Jews Category:Israeli lawyers Category:Jewish activists Category:Jewish lawyers Category:Naturalized citizens of Israel Category:People from Baghdad
title: Kochavi Shemesh
